description: Registers a compute resource in an Amazon GameLift Anywhere fleet. For an Anywhere fleet that's running the Amazon GameLift Agent, the Agent handles all compute registry tasks for you. For an Anywhere fleet that doesn't use the Agent, call this operation to register fleet computes. To register a compute, give the compute a name (must be unique within the fleet) and specify the compute resource's DNS name or IP address. Provide a fleet ID and a fleet location to associate with the compute being registered. You can optionally include the path to a TLS certificate on the compute resource. If successful, this operation returns compute details, including an Amazon GameLift SDK endpoint or Agent endpoint. Game server processes running on the compute can use this endpoint to communicate with the Amazon GameLift service. Each server process includes the SDK endpoint in its call to the Amazon GameLift server SDK action InitSDK(). To view compute details, call DescribeCompute with the compute name.

parameters.name: FleetId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the fleet to register the compute to. You can use either the fleet ID or ARN value.

parameters.name: ComputeName
parameters.description: A descriptive label for the compute resource.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the fleet that the compute belongs to.

nested_items.name: FleetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the fleet that the compute belongs to.

nested_items.name: ComputeName
nested_items.description: A descriptive label for the compute resource. For instances in a managed EC2 fleet, the compute name is the same value as the InstanceId ID.

nested_items.name: ComputeArn
nested_items.description: The ARN that is assigned to a compute resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across locations. Instances in managed EC2 fleets are not assigned a Compute ARN.

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of a compute resource. Amazon GameLift requires a DNS name or IP address for a compute.

nested_items.name: DnsName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of a compute resource. Amazon GameLift requires a DNS name or IP address for a compute.

nested_items.name: ComputeStatus
nested_items.description: Current status of the compute. A compute must have an ACTIVE status to host game sessions.

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The name of the custom location you added to the fleet that this compute resource resides in.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A time stamp indicating when this data object was created. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: OperatingSystem
nested_items.description: The type of operating system on the compute resource.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 instance type that the fleet uses. For registered computes in an Amazon GameLift Anywhere fleet, this property is empty.

nested_items.name: GameLiftServiceSdkEndpoint
nested_items.description: The Amazon GameLift SDK endpoint connection for a registered compute resource in an Anywhere fleet. The game servers on the compute use this endpoint to connect to the Amazon GameLift service.

nested_items.name: GameLiftAgentEndpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of the Amazon GameLift Agent.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The InstanceID of the EC2 instance that is hosting the compute.

nested_items.name: ContainerAttributes
nested_items.description: A set of attributes for each container in the compute.

nested_items.name: ContainerName
nested_items.description: The identifier for a container that's running in a compute.

nested_items.name: ContainerRuntimeId
nested_items.description: The runtime ID for the container that's running in a compute. This value is unique within the compute.

nested_items.name: GameServerContainerGroupDefinitionArn
nested_items.description: The game server container group definition for the compute.
